title: univers - question
content:

but have big problems which regular, light, bold.. to choose.  
ofc i checked txts about frutiger's numering system but im

how to recognize right combi of w&w?
author: iris k

comments.content:
Iris, I don't understand your question. What does "ofc" and "w&w" mean?  
Weights beginning with a 4 are light,  
Weights begininig with a 5 are regular  
Weights beginning with a 6 are medium,  
Weights beginning with a 7 are bold,

styles ending with a 5 are upright roman  
Styles ending with a 6 are italic  
Styles ending with a 7 are condensed,

In other words. Univers 55 is regular weight standard width roman  
Univers 65 is medium weight standard width roman

ChrisL

thank you for your answer.  
ofc is ofcourse, w&w is weight and width.

maybe i dont understand the assignment so good, but.  
i have to pick minimum 4 different styles from the family but it must have some sense- i have to find that sense so i can combine 4 good ones together.i pick some 4 (light, bold, oblique..) the teacher said "no no i'm not sure that one fits, check frutiger's numbering system.) i'm a very big beginner and my classes are on language i dont understand so please have some understanding about my probably stupid question. thanks!!

Iris,

Look at the thread from this link:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/32569](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713230745/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32569 "http://www.typophile.com/node/32569")

ChrisL

I'm not sure exactly what your teacher's asking for, but if i was going to pick 4 fonts from Univers to go together I'd do this: choose one to start, then find a bold, italic, and bold-italic version of it.

For example:  
55 (normal)  
56 (italic)  
75 (bold)  
76 (bold italic)

or:  
47 ("normal" in this example)  
48 (italic)  
67 (bold)  
68 (bold italic)

i am happy to help you one day.
